wash.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to clean something using water and a type of soap
wash.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: It’s your turn to wash the dishes.
wash.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to clean your body with soap and water
wash.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Amy washed and went to bed.
She had a hot bath and washed her hair.
I’m just going to wash my hands.
When a cat has finished eating, it often washes itself.
wash.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: if a river, sea etc washes somewhere, or if something carried by the river or sea is washed somewhere, it flows or moves there
wash.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The waves washed against the shore.
The young man was washed overboard (=pushed from a boat into the sea by the force of the water) in the storm.
The body was washed ashore (=brought to the shore by waves).
wash.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: wash
to clean something with soap and water
Our car needs washing.
Make sure that you wash your hands.
do the washing
to wash clothes that need to be washed
Did you do the laundry this morning?
I do the washing on Wednesdays and Saturdays.
do the washing up
to wash all the cups, plates, knives etc that you have used during a meal
If you do the cooking tonight, I’ll do the washing up.
Who’s going to do the dishes?
cleanse
to make something completely clean, especially using a special substance
Carefully cleanse the cut to get rid of any grit or dirt.
rinse
to wash something with water in order to remove soap or dirt
I’ll just rinse the lettuce under the tap.
scrub
to make something very clean, using a stiff brush and water, or soap and water
Lou was on her knees, scrubbing the kitchen floor.
mop
to wash a floor with a wet mop (=special stick with thick threads on the end)
A cleaner mopped the floor between the beds.
wash.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: an act of cleaning something using soap and water
wash.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Those jeans need a good wash (=a thorough wash).
I’ll just have a quick wash before we go out.
wash.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: clothes that are to be washed, are being washed, or have just been washed
wash.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: You’d better put that shirt in the wash.
Do you need me to put another wash on?
wash.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a liquid used to clean your skin
wash.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: a very thin transparent layer of paint or colour
wash.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: a wide bay (=an area of sea that curves inwards towards the land) on the east coast of England between Norfolk and Lincolnshire
